sameAnalysis.part_name: 这两个名词都表示"建筑物"之意。
means: building ： 普通用词，指任何建筑物，但不涉及建筑物的大小、风格以及所用材料。
structure ： 侧重建筑物的构造形式。

word_mean: 指磨具中磨粒、结合剂和孔隙的组成比例和分布状态。

sentence.Network_en: The theatre is a futuristic steel and glass structure.
sentence.Network_cn: 这家剧院是钢筋和玻璃结构的未来派建筑。

sentence.Network_en: Torn muscles retract, and lose strength, structure, and tightness.
sentence.Network_cn: 撕裂的肌肉会收缩，丧失原来的力量、结构和紧实度。

sentence.Network_en: My grumble is with the structure and organisation of the material.
sentence.Network_cn: 我所不满的是素材的结构和组织。

derivation.yuyuan_name: late Middle English (denoting the process of building): from Old French, or from Latin structura, from struere 'to build'. The verb is rarely found before the 20th cent

entry.def: The structure of something is the way in which it is made, built, or organized.

example.ex: The typical family structure of Freud's patients involved two parents and two children...
example.tran: 弗洛伊德的病人的典型家庭结构是父母二人和两个孩子。

example.ex: The chemical structure of this particular molecule is very unusual.
example.tran: 这个特殊分子的化学结构很不寻常。

entry.def: A structure is something that consists of parts connected together in an ordered way.

example.ex: The feet are highly specialised structures made up of 26 small delicate bones.
example.tran: 脚的结构非常特殊，由 26 块细小的骨头组成。

entry.def: A structure is something that has been built.

example.ex: About half of those funds has gone to repair public roads, structures and bridges...
example.tran: 那些基金中大约有一半已被用来维修公路、公共建筑物和桥梁。

example.ex: The house was a handsome four-story brick structure.
example.tran: 这所房子是一幢造型美观的四层砖砌建筑物。

entry.tran: 系统安排;精心组织;使形成体系
entry.def: If you structure something, you arrange it in a careful, organized pattern or system.

example.ex: By structuring the course this way, we're forced to produce something the companies think is valuable.
example.tran: 这样制定发展规划后，我们不得不生产各公司认为有价值的东西。

means.word_mean: 1. a thing constructed; a complex construction or entity;

sentences.sentence: "the structure consisted of a series of arches"
"she wore her hair in an amazing construction of whirls and ribbons"

means.word_mean: 2. the manner of construction of something and the arrangement of its parts;

sentences.sentence: "artists must study the structure of the human body"

means.word_mean: 3. the complex composition of knowledge as elements and their combinations;
5. the people in a society considered as a system organized by a characteristic pattern of relationships;

sentences.sentence: "the social organization of England and America is very different"
"sociologists have studied the changing structure of the family"

auth_sentence.content: The current funding structure doesn t really support this.
auth_sentence.res_content: The current funding structure doesn t really support this.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: The current funding structure doesn t really support this.

stems_affixes.word_buile: de去掉,变坏+struct建立,结构→adj.破坏的 n.故意或有计划的破坏 v.破坏

destruct破坏+ive……的→adj.破坏性
industry工业, 产业+ial……的→industrial
industry勤奋+ious..的→industrious
instruct[v.教,教授;命令,指示]+ive表形容词→adj.有益的, 教育性的

stems_affixes.value_cn: 仪器的;器械的;乐器的;起作用的;有帮助的

obstruct[v.阻隔,阻塞[道路,通道等]n.阻碍物,障碍物]+ion表名词→n.妨碍,障碍物

stems_affixes.value_cn: 建造,构造;建筑物,结构;释义,解释
stems_affixes.word_buile: construct[v.建设,建造,构造;创立]+ion表名词→n.建造,构造;建筑物,结构;释义,解释
de去掉,变坏+struct建立,结构→adj.破坏的 n.故意或有计划的破坏 v.破坏
destruct破坏+ion表名词→弄坏结构→破坏

stems_affixes.value_cn: 工业, 产业, 行业, 勤奋
stems_affixes.word_buile: indu=in+str=struct建立,结构+y→n.工业, 产业, 行业, 勤奋
instruct[v.教,教授;命令,指示]+ion表名词→n.教授;指导;[n.]用法说明[书],操作指南
instruct[v.教,教授;命令,指示]+or人→n.指导者,教员
in内+stru=struct建立,结构+ment物→内部构造→仪器,工具
instrumental[adj.仪器的;器械的;乐器的;起作用的;有帮助的]+ity性质→n.手段
ob反+struct建立,结构→反建设→阻塞,阻碍
struct建立,结构+ure表名词→n.结构,构造;建筑物 v.构造,建造

stems_affixes.value_cn: 基础,下部结构,地下建筑
stems_affixes.word_buile: sub下面+struct建立,结构+ion表名词→建造在下面
super上面+structure结构→上面的结构→上层建筑
con共同+struct建立,结构→共同建立→建设,建造
de坏+stroy=struct建立,结构→v.破坏,摧毁,消灭
de去掉,变坏+struct建立,结构→adj.破坏的 n.故意或有计划的破坏 v.破坏
in进+struct建立,结构→把知识建立进去→指导,指示
ob反+struct建立,结构→反建设→阻塞,阻碍
re再+construct[v.建设,建造,构造;创立]→v.重建,再建;重现,再现
struct建立,结构+ure表名词→n.结构,构造;建筑物 v.构造,建造

Sentence.sentence: Along with the new structure came a more demanding academic program, the percentage of freshmen taking biology jumped from 17 to 95.
But there is no evidence to show that the structure of eyes is changed by wearing glasses at a young age.
It can permanently change the eye structure

Kapur points out that while the model adopted by many teachers when introducing students to new knowledge―providing lots of structure and guidance early on, until the students show that they can do it on their own―makes intuitive sense, it may not be the best way to promote learning.
The apparent struggles of the floundering (挣扎的）group have what Kapur calls a "hidden efficacy": they lead people to understand the deep structure of problems, not simply their correct solutions
In the real world, problems rarely come neatly packaged, so being able to discern their deep structure is key.

sentences.en: A flower has quite a complicated structure.
sentences.cn: 一朵花的结构相当复杂。

sentences.en: Geologists study the structure of the rocks.
sentences.cn: 地质学家研究岩石结构。

means.word_mean: 有结构的事物; 复杂的整体; 建筑物

sentences.en: The Eiffel Tower is one of the most famous structures in the world.
sentences.cn: 艾菲尔铁塔是世界上最著名的建筑物之一。

means.word_mean: 组织; 安排; 构造; 制定

sentences.en: It's often difficult to structure one's career.
sentences.cn: 安排自己的职业通常很困难。

sentences.en: She hoped that more activities like this could be structured.
sentences.cn: 她希望能组织更多这类活动。
